column1: Ranking Member Sensenbrenner’s statement on The House Antitrust Commercial and Administrative Law Majority Staff Report on Big Tech.  https://t.co/PwPDobkf7v

Opening remarks at today’s Subcommittee on Antitrust Commercial and Administrative Law hearing on Proposals to Strengthen the Antitrust Laws and Restore Competition Online (Big Tech). https://t.co/uctZp1iWx9
I am pleased to see Taiwan ease import restrictions on U.S. beef and pork. This is an important step for advancement of a free trade agreement with our Taiwanese partners.  https://t.co/58tjUI8OsM

Today Congressman Jim Sensenbrenner (R-Menomonee Falls) sent the following letter to Wauwatosa Mayor Dennis McBride offering assistance to immediately address the deteriorating security and policing situation in Tosa. @WauwatosaWI https://t.co/JJ6O9JkHHM
“Conservatives are consumers too.” - Rep. Sensenbrenner at today’s #BigTechHearing https://t.co/xuufLun7oR

Today marks the 30th anniversary of the signing of the Americans with Disabilities Act. My late wife Cheryl was the ultimate champion for disabled rights and while it is a bittersweet anniversary to mark I am eternally proud of what she accomplished in her lifetime. #ADA #ADA30 https://t.co/1fcjulHGOV
Rep. Sensenbrenner Statement on the Passing of @repjohnlewis https://t.co/JxEGYqdNWD

The #USMCA trade agreement goes into effect today! I’m proud to have supported this historic agreement. This new trade deal is a win for Wisconsin farmers manufacturers & small businesses. The USMCA will create jobs & help grow our economy.
Statement on Passing of Cheryl Sensenbrenner https://t.co/OxQOfXrKSY

Rep. Sensenbrenner calls for cooperation in removing police officers with misconduct on their records. “The sooner we get the bad cops off the force the sooner there will no longer be any bad apples to spoil the whole barrel.” https://t.co/N4fQy0Pt2e
As the former chairman of the House Science Committee I would like to congratulate @NASA & @SpaceX on a successful launch from American soil! #LaunchAmerica #CrewDragon https://t.co/WtgYrsPnF1
Rep. Sensenbrenner Statement Following Vote Against $3 Trillion COVID-19 Democrat Spending Wish List: https://t.co/ETbbl4j4MD
The House Democrat proposal to allow for a system of proxy voting on the floor of the House of Representatives is not one I can support. https://t.co/Ui1KoQq8At

Today I sent a letter to United States @IRSnews Commissioner Charles P. Rettig asking him to address the numerous barriers the residents of Wisconsin’s Fifth Congressional District are encountering in determining the status of their economic impact payments and tax refunds. https://t.co/YexGlmkZGg

I want to thank the people of Taiwan for their generous donation of PPE to our great state. Our front line healthcare providers need all the tools available to combat this virus. https://t.co/eCrMnjaQZf

Congressman @davidcicilline and I are leading more than 100 Dems and Republicans who want access to funding in the next relief bill to support the small local news outlets that provide essential information regarding public health and safety local events and democracy. https://t.co/8Pl5VPLTRV
Rep. Sensenbrenner Statement on the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act: #PaycheckProtectionProgram https://t.co/38l2bvXTzu

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram is officially out of money. Now is not the time to play partisan politics. Workers are struggling through no fault of their own. Wisconsin’s small businesses are counting on Congress to do the right thing & replenish these funds now! https://t.co/Q85udKECbr

Rep. Sensenbrenner statement on USMCA:   “I was proud to support the USMCA in the House. This historic bipartisan agreement will help modernize trade and expand America’s economy. It is a victory for Wisconsin farmers manufacturers businesses and workers.”
